generated_prompt: Reflect on a recent situation where you had high expectations for yourself or someone else. Describe how you felt when things didn't go exactly as planned. Explore the thoughts that crossed your mind when faced with imperfections or setbacks. Consider if you tend to see things as either a complete success or a total failure, without leaving room for anything in between.
generated_text: I had this perfect image in my mind of how things were supposed to go, but of course, reality had other plans. It's like I can't help but see things in extremes - either everything is flawless or a complete disaster. When things didn't turn out as expected, it felt like the whole world came crashing down. It's hard to accept that maybe there's a middle ground, a gray area where things can still be okay even if they're not perfect. But in the moment, all I could see was black and white, success or failure, with no room for anything in between.

generated_prompt: Write about an upcoming event or situation that you are feeling anxious about. Describe how you imagine it will unfold and how you think you will feel during and after it. Try to capture your thoughts about the event in a way that reflects your concerns and fears about the outcome. Be honest about the emotions and scenarios that play out in your mind as you anticipate this future event.
generated_text: I can already see it playing out in my mind – the meeting tomorrow is going to be a disaster. I'll stumble over my words, everyone will stare in disbelief, and I'll feel like a complete failure. Afterward, the embarrassment will linger, and I'll replay every awkward moment in my head on repeat. It's like I'm trapped in this cycle of predicting the worst outcomes, and I can't shake off this impending sense of doom.

generated_prompt: Write about a recent situation where you felt a strong emotion, whether positive or negative. Reflect on how that emotion influenced your thoughts and actions in that moment. Dive into how your feelings shaped your perceptions and decisions without explicitly stating it.
generated_text: I was so anxious during the team meeting today, feeling like everyone was judging me silently. My heart was racing, palms sweaty, and I couldn't shake off the feeling of being incompetent. I kept thinking that my colleagues were avoiding eye contact because they were disappointed in my work. It's crazy how my emotions can twist everything around, making me believe that everyone sees me as a failure, even though there's no concrete evidence for it. It's like my feelings were painting a distorted picture of reality, and I couldn't see past that fog of insecurity.

generated_prompt: Write about a recent interaction you had with someone that left you feeling a certain way about yourself or them. generated_text: I had a chat with my colleague today, and she seemed a bit distant. I couldn't help but think she was being outright rude. I labeled her as "unfriendly" in my mind, and that stuck with me throughout the day. It's funny how one word can color your whole perception of someone. Maybe there's more to her behavior that I'm not considering, but that label is hard to shake off now.

generated_prompt: Reflect on a recent situation where you felt disappointed or frustrated. Describe what happened and how you felt in that moment. Try to recall if there were specific details or events that stood out to you more than others. Consider whether these details might have colored your overall perception of the situation. Write about how focusing on these specific aspects may have influenced your feelings and thoughts about the entire experience.
generated_text: So, today at work, my boss praised everyone's presentations, but of course, he had to point out one tiny mistake in mine. Like, seriously? I can't believe I spent hours preparing just to be criticized for a minor thing. It's all I can think about now. It's like his words overshadowed all the positive feedback I received. Why does my brain always zoom in on the negatives? It's so frustrating.

generated_prompt: Reflect on a recent interaction you had with someone close to you. generated_text: I can't shake off the feeling that when I was talking to Sarah yesterday, she was totally judging me in her head. But maybe I'm just overthinking it, right? I mean, she's my friend, she wouldn't do that... would she? It's messing with my head, man.

generated_prompt: Write about a recent interaction you had with a friend or colleague where something didn't go as expected. Reflect on how you interpreted their behavior during that interaction.
